definitions.definition: to clean, polish or make something smooth with a brush

examples.text: to **brush your hair/teeth**
to brush your shoes
A tiled floor is easy to brush clean.

definitions.definition: to remove or try to remove something from a place or surface with a brush or with your hand

examples.text: I brushed the dirt off my jacket.
He pulled out a handkerchief and **brushed away the tears**.
Gail brushed a strand of hair out of her eyes.
She brushed the fly away.
Lucille brushed at the blood on his jacket.
He brushed the mud from his coat.
She brushed away her tears.
Her hair was brushed back in a pony tail.
She brushed her hair out of her eyes.
I brushed the crumbs off the table.

definitions.definition: to put something, for example oil, milk or egg, on something using a brush
definitions.sensetop: brush A with Bbrush B over, on, etc. A

examples.text: Brush the pastry with beaten egg.
Brush beaten egg over the pastry.
examples.contextForm: brush B over, on, etc. A

definitions.definition: to touch somebody/something lightly while moving close to them/it
definitions.sensetop: brush by/past somebody/somethingbrush against somebody/somethingbrush somethingbrush something with something

examples.text: She brushed past him.
His hand accidentally brushed against hers.
The leaves brushed her cheek.
He brushed her lips with his.
I hardly noticed the man who brushed past me in the corridor.
She brushed by him and dashed up the stairs.
She carefully avoided brushing against the man sitting beside her at the table.

wordOrigin: verb Middle English: noun from Old French broisse; verb partly from Old French brosser ‘to sweep’.
